readability_reflection: I personally found string concatenation more readable because it seemed more intuitive. I also do not have a lot of experience using string interpolation so that may have been a factor, as well. One of the issues I had was I was not sure how spaces were handled in string interpolation, where as in string concatenation, I knew spaces would be printed if they were in the quotation marks.
comprehension_debugging: I felt using string concatenation made it easier to understand and debug code snippets because it seemed more intuitive and what I was more familiar with.
preference_rationale: I would prefer string concatenation for future programming tasks because I thought it made code more readable. The + sign is universally and immediately more recognizable, signaling that the strings will be combined. I also feel that having less curly braces makes the code appear cleaner and easier to read.
learning_curve: I have less experience with string interpolation so that may be the reason string concatenation seemed more readable to me. Whenever I saw the + sign, I immediately knew that the strings would be combined, which is also why it seemed more intuitive.
suggestions_improvement: Since I am not as familiar with string interpolation, this may just be my initial reaction, but I felt the extra curly braces made the code more cluttered and less readable. I would like more experience using string interpolation to be sure, but that seemed to be the main reason why I preferred using string concatenation.
